title: Laptop Overheating
description: Fix laptop overheating, loud fan noise, and thermal issues.

steps.title: Use on Hard, Flat Surface
steps.instruction: Place laptop on a hard, flat surface (not bed, pillow, or lap). Ensure ventilation slots on bottom and sides are not blocked.

steps.title: Clean Air Vents and Fans
steps.instruction: Shut down laptop. Use compressed air to blow dust out of air vents. Hold can upright and use short bursts. Clean regularly.

steps.title: Close Resource-Intensive Programs
steps.instruction: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) → Check CPU usage → Close programs using high CPU/memory resources.

steps.title: Adjust Power Settings
steps.instruction: Settings → System → Power & sleep → Additional power settings → Choose 'Balanced' or 'Power saver' mode to reduce heat.

steps.title: Use Laptop Cooling Pad
steps.instruction: Consider using an external cooling pad with fans. This helps with airflow and keeps laptop cooler during heavy use.
